definition: (coll.) all right?/OK?
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
(negative prefix)/not/no
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello

sentences.english: Frank, how about some bacon with your French toast ?
sentences.chinese: 弗兰克，弄点儿咸肉就着煎面包片儿吃好不好？

sentences.english: Have not used the Freeze said, okay.
sentences.chinese: 没有用过的别乱说，好不好。

sentences.english: Kiddies, let's guess a riddle before our class, OK?
sentences.chinese: 在上课之前，小朋友们，我们猜个谜语，好不好？

sentences.english: Why dont we have dinner together to celebrate the success of our first deal.
sentences.chinese: 咱们一起吃晚饭，庆祝我们的首次交易成功，好不好？

sentences.english: But voters will judge him by how he played it.
sentences.chinese: 但投票者将会从他干的好不好来判断他。

sentences.english: At least I needed to reach Wai Qiao village to check out that old road for crossing the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 起码走到外乔自然村看看那座山好不好爬才算。

sentences.english: Don't make such a fuss. I'm sure you will like today's music.
sentences.chinese: 别那么激动好不好，我敢保证你会喜欢今天的音乐的。

sentences.english: How do you know if the feng shui in your home is good or not?
sentences.chinese: 怎么才知道你家的风水好不好？

sentences.english: I'll do it when I HAs time.
sentences.chinese: 别罗唆了，好不好？我有具体时间就去做。

sentences.english: Hey, here's an idea. Why don't we use our wedding china today?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，我有个主意我们今天用我们的结婚瓷盘好不好？

sentences.english: What have old ivy leaves to do with your getting well?
sentences.chinese: 常青藤叶子跟你病好不好有什么关系？

sentences.english: Doris:There is snow on Yangmingshan. Let's go visit the mountain together.
sentences.chinese: 阳明山下雪了耶，我们一起上山去看好不好。

sentences.english: What about going to Nu Ren Jie? There are a lot of clothes stores there.
sentences.chinese: 去女人街好不好？那里卖衣服的小店特别多。

sentences.english: My sister is only seven, but she always tells me whether my pictures are good or not.
sentences.chinese: 我妹妹才七岁，但她总能说出我画得好不好。

sentences.english: Do you think I should get my lips plumped ?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我去丰唇好不好？

definition: right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
how?/how about?/how was it?/how are things?
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
otherwise/or else/how about...?/either... (or...)
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
it doesn't matter
what are you doing?/whatever for?/why on earth?
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
(onom.) gentle laughter/chuckle
(a groaning sound)
(nonverbal grunt as interjection)/OK, yeah/what?
interjection indicating approval, appreciation or agreement
anyway/in any case/to come over from the enemy's side
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
youngest/most junior/tiny/one (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers, esp. on telephone or in military)/one or ace on dice or dominoes/variant of 吆[yao1], to shout
surname Yao
